items.title: Can't build the project on windows
items.body:
Hey there, 
I'm trying to build the project on my windows machine using the process described in the README.md of the master branch but I'm getting the following error.

**Steps I took:**
1. git submodule update --init
2. cargo build

```
PS C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio> cargo build
warning: output filename collision.
The bin target `augmented-codegen` in package `augmented-codegen v0.1.0 (C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\crates\apps\looper\augmented-codegen)` has the same output filename as the lib target `augmented-codegen` in package `augmented-codegen v0.1.0 (C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\crates\apps\looper\augmented-codegen)`.
Colliding filename is: C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\target\debug\augmented_codegen.pdb
The targets should have unique names.
Consider changing their names to be unique or compiling them separately.
This may become a hard error in the future; see <https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/6313>.
warning: output filename collision.
The bin target `tas_v2` in package `tas_v2 v0.0.1 (C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\crates\apps\tremolo-plugin)` has the same output filename as the lib target `tas_v2` in package `tas_v2 v0.0.1 (C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\crates\apps\tremolo-plugin)`.
Colliding filename is: C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\target\debug\deps\tas_v2.pdb
The targets should have unique names.
Consider changing their names to be unique or compiling them separately.
This may become a hard error in the future; see <https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/6313>.
warning: output filename collision.
The bin target `tas_v2` in package `tas_v2 v0.0.1 (C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\crates\apps\tremolo-plugin)` has the same output filename as the lib target `tas_v2` in package `tas_v2 v0.0.1 (C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\crates\apps\tremolo-plugin)`.
Colliding filename is: C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\target\debug\tas_v2.pdb
The targets should have unique names.
Consider changing their names to be unique or compiling them separately.
This may become a hard error in the future; see <https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/6313>.
   Compiling libsamplerate-sys v0.1.12 (C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\crates\vendor\libsamplerate-sys)
   Compiling float_next_after v0.1.5
   Compiling wgpu-types v0.14.1
   Compiling range-alloc v0.1.3
   Compiling profiling v1.0.7
   Compiling color_quant v1.1.0
   Compiling renderdoc-sys v0.7.1
   Compiling windows_x86_64_msvc v0.36.1
   Compiling wgpu-core v0.14.2
   Compiling iced_style v0.7.0
   Compiling audio-processor-standalone-midi v1.9.0 (C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\crates\augmented\application\audio-processor-standalone-midi)
   Compiling lyon_algorithms v1.0.3
   Compiling lyon_tessellation v1.0.10
error: failed to run custom build command for `libsamplerate-sys v0.1.12 (C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\crates\vendor\libsamplerate-sys)`

Caused by:
  process didn't exit successfully: `C:\Development\rust\augmented-audio\target\debug\build\libsamplerate-sys-c90e688cd836bcea\build-script-build` (exit code: 101)
  --- stdout
  CMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE_x86_64-pc-windows-msvc = None
  CMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE_x86_64_pc_windows_msvc = None
  HOST_CMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE = None
  CMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE = None
  CMAKE_GENERATOR_x86_64-pc-windows-msvc = None
  CMAKE_GENERATOR_x86_64_pc_windows_msvc = None
  HOST_CMAKE_GENERATOR = None
  CMAKE_GENERATOR = None
  CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH_x86_64-pc-windows-msvc = None
  CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH_x86_64_pc_windows_msvc = None
  HOST_CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH = None
  CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH = None
  CMAKE_x86_64-pc-windows-msvc = None
  CMAKE_x86_64_pc_windows_msvc = None
  HOST_CMAKE = None
  CMAKE = None
  running: "cmake" "C:\\Development\\rust\\augmented-audio\\crates\\vendor\\libsamplerate-sys\\libsamplerate" "-G" "Visual Studio 16 2019" "-Thost=x64" "-Ax64" "-DLIBSAMPLERATE_TESTS=OFF" "-DLIBSAMPLERATE_EXAMPLES=OFF" "-DLIBSAMPLERATE_INSTALL=OFF" "-DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=C:\\Development\\rust\\augmented-audio\\target\\debug\\build\\libsamplerate-sys-c9ca1e229308a87e\\out" "-DCMAKE_C_FLAGS= -nologo -MD -Brepro" "-DCMAKE_C_FLAGS_DEBUG= -nologo -MD -Brepro" "-DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS= -nologo -MD -Brepro" "-DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_DEBUG= -nologo -MD -Brepro" "-DCMAKE_ASM_FLAGS= -nologo -MD -Brepro" "-DCMAKE_ASM_FLAGS_DEBUG= -nologo -MD -Brepro" "-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug"

  --- stderr
  CMake Error: The source directory "C:/Development/rust/augmented-audio/crates/vendor/libsamplerate-sys/libsamplerate" does not appear to contain CMakeLists.txt.
  Specify --help for usage, or press the help button on the CMake GUI.
  thread 'main' panicked at '
  command did not execute successfully, got: exit code: 1

  build script failed, must exit now', C:\Users\info\.cargo\registry\src\index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f\cmake-0.1.49\src\lib.rs:1104:5
  note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error[E0432]: unresolved import `midir::os::unix`
  --> crates\augmented\application\audio-processor-standalone-midi\src\host.rs:29:16
   |
29 | use midir::os::unix::VirtualInput;
   |                ^^^^ could not find `unix` in `os`

error[E0599]: no method named `create_virtual` found for struct `MidiInput` in the current scope
  --> crates\augmented\application\audio-processor-standalone-midi\src\host.rs:92:21
   |
92 |         match input.create_virtual(
   |               ------^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ method not found in `MidiInput`

Some errors have detailed explanations: E0432, E0599.
For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0432`.
error: could not compile `audio-processor-standalone-midi` (lib) due to 2 previous errors
```
Sorry, if this is a really stupid question, but I'm just digging into rust and finding out about some use cases, but I don't have any idea about it so far.

Any hint, what might go wrong here?

Thanks for your time in advance :)
